fields.intro: Happy holidays everyone. Our review of Gyana in 2021, reflections on no-code data platforms and what comes next. Have a wonderful break!
fields.body:
Happy holidays everyone.

If you’re reading this, chances are you helped us in some way this year. So … thank you. It means a lot, to all of us.

**2021 was a good year for Gyana.** We launched [**Gyana 2.0**](\"https://www.gyana.com/blog/the-next-chapter-of-gyana\"), built our fantastic [**community**](\"https://www.facebook.com/groups/891928461364849\") and helped thousands of customers discover new ways to [**work with data**](\"https://www.gyana.com/blog/learnings-from-one-week-with-gyana\").

Today, businesses who want be data-driven have only two options: spend $100k and hire a team of data engineers, or build a [**Rube-Goldberg machine**](\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rube_Goldberg_machine\") of connectors, zaps, spreadsheets and dashboards. As you told us, in over a thousand chats and video calls.

2021 is the year we proved, definitely, a third way is possible - the power of a custom data platform but with a no-code interface, for less than your Zoom subscription.

It took us a while to get here, but we’ve finally built something we’re really proud of. And we’re seeing the impact with our users, who have synced a total of **367,780,394 rows of data** into Gyana.

Although on that note, I’m not sure about that word “users”…

### **For the builders...**

My number one learning in 2021 is about the appetite to build.

Gyana is not a community of “users”, it’s a community of “builders”. Right now, you get a blank slate, a handful of tutorials, and it’s up to you to create. And you’ve exceeded our expectations, and then some.

Kudos to the person who built a workflow with a record **78 nodes**. It’s a thing of beauty. Really, it belongs in the Tate. You’ll never be truly appreciated, but we know what you did.

As builders ourselves, we understand the risk you take when committing to a platform like Gyana. Thank you for trusting us. **It’s a privilege to watch you unleash your creativity.** You keep being awesome, and we’ll do our best to get out of your way.

### **What next for 2022?**

For 2021, we challenged ourselves to take the fundamentals of an enterprise data stack (ETL, modelling, analytics , BI, orchestration, IAM, …) and wrap it into a **single no-code web app that one person can manage**.

In 2022, we plan to build on that foundation. Our guiding principle: whatever the data source, analysis workflow, or dashboard - **you can build it in Gyana**. Keep an eye out for hundreds of new connectors, custom APIs and dashboards themes.

On top of that, we’ll be introducing new features to build towards our goal of the complete data platform. **Actions** enable you to use your data results to do things - like export a Google Sheet or send emails. **Predictions** will help you understand trends and forecast results using machine learning. And our **developer platform** will enable you to build your own data analytics application on Gyana - in days, not months.

Finally, we’re going to put a _big_ focus on learning and educational content. Video tutorials, pre-built templates, blog posts, walkthroughs, and a complete revamp of the website … **we know how important it is and it’s coming**.

Have a wonderful break!

❤️ David + the Gyana team
We've put together courses, videos and deep dives to teach you how Gyana works.

[{"type": "loom", "value": {"loom_id": "413d09614b2b41d3bd5a7b4514176be7", "caption": "Video overview of our integrations"}, "id": "ee1da91f-b9a2-498c-8058-5e146eacbb17"}, {"type": "text", "value": "

An integration is a source of data, like a CSV file, Google Sheet, ads account, database, or web app.

Since you can't do data analytics without data (!), it's our top priority to make it as effortless as possible for you to integrate data from anywhere.

\ud83d\udca1 If you're having difficulties importing data, take a look at our troubleshooting guide.

\ud83d\ude9b Choosing your import method

At a high level, you have three ways to get data into Gyana: connectors, sheets and uploads. We'll go through them one by one.

Connectors

Connectors are specially made integrations for specific data sources, like Google Analytics or Facebook Ads. We support 80+ connectors out of the box, with 150+ planned for the end of 2021.

Connectors are the best choice, if available. After a one-time authorization process, new data is synced on a regular basis, and you'll have many tables of data to choose from.

\ud83d\udca1 The data sync frequency is 24 hours. You can set the daily sync time in your project settings.

Connectors are powered by our unique partnership with Fivetran. They've built an enterprise grade data integration platform that is trusted by 2000+ demanding customers. You'll interact with them in the connector authorization page.

Google Sheets

If there's no dedicated connector, Google Sheets offers a great alternative for getting your data ready:

  • Many tools offer one-off or scheduled exports to Google Sheets
  • Many automation tools (Zapier, Pabbly Connect, n8n) write to Google Sheets
  • Typing sheet.new in your browser bar is the quickest way we know to quickly jot down or copy + paste data

Gyana has a native Google Sheets connector that will take a few seconds to import. Just share the sheet with us, copy and paste the URL, and you're done.

\ud83d\udca1 By default, new data will not automatically sync from your sheet if you make changes. You need to manually re-sync. We have improvements to this planned.

Upload CSV

Your final alternative is the swiss-army knife of data, the CSV file. Nowadays, most tools (including Excel, databases, web apps, ads accounts) will export a CSV file that you can download and upload to Gyana.

Our native CSV importer is designed to handle most CSV nonsense, including quoted newlines, jagged rows and autodetecting headers. If your CSV file fails to import, you can always try uploading to Google Drive, opening as a Google Sheet, and connect to that instead.

\ud83d\udca1 We will always autodetect the first line of the CSV as a header row.

\ud83d\udd2e What does the future hold?

We know first hand the pain of duct taping tools together to move your data around. Our focus is to add seamless integration to as many data sources as possible, including webhooks, APIs and web scrapers.

Down the line, we're also exploring hosting public datasets (e.g. demographic segmentations, Google trends), and even paid datasets from partner providers. If that's something you'd be interested in trying out, please get in touch!

", "id": "52b1f5e1-d73a-4985-832c-605caf7a28e5"}]
